message.content:
cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with learning high-level controls over the global structure of sequence generation, particularly in the context of symbolic music generation with complex language models. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including cs.SD (Sound), cs.SI (Speech and Natural Language Processing), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). However, given the focus on music generation and language models, cs.SD and cs.SI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also presents a new method for encoding musical style using Transformer autoencoders, which suggests a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the empirical evaluation of the method on music datasets further supports the relevance of cs.SD and cs.CL.
